content:
Congratulations on your upcoming half-marathon and your new shoes! Increasing mileage safely is crucial to avoid injuries and ensure consistent progress. Here are some tips to help you do so:

1. **Gradual Progression**: Aim to increase your weekly mileage by no more than 10% each week. This allows your body to adapt to the demands of running without sudden shocks.
2. **Listen to Your Body**: Pay attention to your body's signals. If you experience pain or discomfort, take rest days or modify your training plan as needed.
3. **Build Up Your Base Mileage**: Focus on building your weekly base mileage before increasing your long run distance. Aim for 3-4 shorter runs during the week, with one longer run on the weekends.
4. **Incorporate Walk Breaks**: If you're new to running or increasing your mileage significantly, consider incorporating walk breaks into your runs. This can help your body adapt to the demands of running.
5. **Strengthen Your Core and Glutes**: Weak core and glute muscles can lead to poor running form and increase your risk of injury. Incorporate strength training exercises 2-3 times a week to target these areas.
6. **Incorporate Rest and Recovery**: Rest and recovery are just as important as running. Ensure you're getting 1-2 rest days per week and prioritizing stretching, foam rolling, and self-myofascial release.
7. **Hydrate and Fuel Properly**: Adequate hydration and nutrition are crucial for optimal performance. Focus on consuming a balanced diet, staying hydrated, and fueling your runs with the right snacks and electrolytes.
8. **Get Enough Sleep**: Aim for 7-9 hours of sleep each night to help your body recover from the physical demands of running.
9. **Mix Up Your Route and Terrain**: Varying your route and terrain can help reduce the risk of overuse injuries. Incorporate hills, trails, and different surfaces to keep your runs interesting and challenging.
10. **Seek Professional Guidance**: If you're new to running or unsure about how to increase your mileage safely, consider consulting a running coach or experienced runner for personalized guidance.

Regarding your new shoes, it's great that you're feeling the difference in terms of cushioning and support! Make sure to break them in gradually by wearing them for shorter runs and gradually increasing the distance.

Remember, consistency and patience are key when increasing your mileage. Stay committed to your training plan, listen to your body, and you'll be ready to crush your half-marathon in no time!
